meanings.definition: Plinkiest (adjective): superlative form of plinky, characterized by a light, metallic sound
meanings.sent1: The wind chime made the plinkiest sound in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: The tiny bell had the plinkiest tone among all the bells in the orchestra.
meanings.sent3: The plinkiest notes from the xylophone made the baby giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the plinkiest melody in the room.
meanings.sent5: The plinkiest sound of raindrops on the window was soothing.

meanings.definition: Plinkiest (noun): the most delicate or high-pitched plinking sound
meanings.sent1: The plinkiest came from the smallest bell on the tree.
meanings.sent2: The plinkiest was heard when the glass marble hit the floor.
meanings.sent3: The plinkiest of all the sounds was the cat's purring.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet room, the plinkiest was the sound of a pin dropping.
meanings.sent5: The plinkiest of all was the sound of a single raindrop falling.

meanings.definition: Plinkiest (verb): to make the most delicate or high-pitched plinking sound
meanings.sent1: She plinkiested on the piano keys with great care.
meanings.sent2: The musician plinkiests on the strings of the guitar effortlessly.
meanings.sent3: The cat loves to plinkiest on the window with its claws.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to plinkiest in her ears long after he spoke.
meanings.sent5: The raindrops plinkiested on the roof, creating a calming rhythm.
